</table>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Worldwide sales
for the third quarter and nine months 2008 compared to 2007 reflects unit
growth and the positive effect of the relatively weaker U.S. dollar.&#160; The relatively weaker U.S. dollar increased
third quarter 2008 consolidated net sales by 4.7 percent, Total International
sales by 9.2 percent, Pharmaceutical Products segment sales by 4.8 percent,
Diagnostic Products segment sales by 7.5 percent and Vascular Products segment
sales by 5.4 percent over the third quarter of 2007.&#160; The relatively weaker U.S. dollar also
increased the first nine months 2008 consolidated net sales by 5.4 percent,
Total International sales by 10.7 percent, Pharmaceutical Products segment
sales by 5.6 percent, Diagnostic Products segment sales by 8.2 percent and
Vascular Products segment sales by 5.6 percent over the first nine months of
2007.&#160; The relatively weaker U.S. dollar
increased third quarter 2007 consolidated net sales by 2.8 percent, Total
International sales by 5.7 percent, Pharmaceutical Products segment sales by
3.0 percent, Diagnostic Products segment sales by 3.9 percent and Vascular
Products segment sales by 2.4 percent over the third quarter of 2006.&#160; The relatively weaker U.S. dollar also
increased the first nine months 2007 consolidated net sales by 2.7 percent,
Total International sales by 5.5 percent, Pharmaceutical Products segment sales
by 2.8 percent, Diagnostic Products segment sales by 3.9 percent and Vascular
Products segment sales by 2.4 percent over the first nine months of 2006.&#160; Sales growth in 2008 for the Vascular
Products segment was favorably impacted by the U.S. launch of the <i>Xience V</i> drug-eluting stent in the third
quarter of 2008.&#160; Sales growth in 2007
for the Nutritional Products segment was unfavorably impacted by the completion
of the co-promotion of <i>Synagis</i> in
2006.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\105537\08-26469-1\task3197997\26469-1-fe.htm',USER='105537',CD='Oct 31 20:54 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 44.3pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL REVIEW</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 1.1pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 1.1pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A comparison of significant
product group sales for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30 is as
follows.&#160; Percent changes are versus the
prior year and are based on unrounded numbers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(dollars
in millions)</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="36%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:36.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Immunochemistry</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,135</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,835</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="221" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="69" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="78" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="69" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="78" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="6" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Increased sales of <i>HUMIRA</i> and the addition of <i>Lupron</i> sales in 2008 accounted for the
majority of the sales increase for U.S. Specialty products in 2008.&#160; Increased sales of <i>HUMIRA</i> and <i>Depakote</i>
accounted for the majority of the sales increase for U.S. Specialty products in
2007. U.S. sales of <i>HUMIRA</i> were
$1.5 billion, $1.1 billion and $806 million for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2008, 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; U.S.
Primary Care sales in 2008 were impacted by a significant decrease in sales of <i>Omnicef </i>due to generic competition,
partially offset by increased sales of <i>Niaspan</i>
and <i>TriCor</i>.&#160; U.S. Primary Care sales in 2007 were
favorably impacted by sales of <i>Niaspan</i>,
a new product from the acquisition of Kos Pharmaceuticals Inc. in the fourth
quarter of 2006, and <i>TriCor</i> and
were unfavorably impacted by decreased sales of <i>Biaxin</i>.&#160; Increased
sales of <i>HUMIRA</i> favorably
impacted International Pharmaceutical sales in both 2008 and 2007.&#160; International sales of <i>HUMIRA</i> were $1.666 billion, $986 million
and $617 million for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2008, 2007 and
2006, respectively.&#160; International
Pediatric Nutritionals sales increases in 2008 and 2007 were due primarily to
volume growth in developing countries.&#160;
The favorable effect of the relatively weaker U.S. dollar favorably
impacted international product sales growth in both years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The gross profit
margin was 55.3 percent for the
third quarter 2008, compared to 55.1 percent for the third quarter 2007.&#160; First nine months 2008 gross profit margin
was 56.3 percent, compared to 55.8 percent for the first nine months 2007.&#160; The increases in the gross profit margins in
2008 were due primarily to favorable product and business mix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Research and
development expenses increased 6.2
percent in the third quarter 2008 and the first nine months 2008 over
comparable 2007 periods.&#160; These increases
reflect increased spending to support pipeline programs, including oncology,
immunology, hepatitis C, neuroscience and drug eluting stents.&#160; The majority of research and development
expenditures is concentrated on pharmaceutical products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Selling, general
and administrative expenses for the third quarter and first nine months 2008
increased 6.3 percent and 11.0 percent, respectively, over the
comparable 2007 periods.&#160; These increases
reflect increased selling and marketing support for new and existing products,
including continued spending for <i>HUMIRA </i>and
the U.S. launch of <i>Xience V</i>, as
well as spending on other marketed pharmaceutical products.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\105537\08-26469-1\task3197997\26469-1-fe.htm',USER='105537',CD='Oct 31 20:54 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL REVIEW</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 1.1pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 1.1pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5in .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Conclusion of TAP
Pharmaceutical Products Inc. Joint Venture</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5in .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;30, 2008,
Abbott and Takeda concluded their TAP Pharmaceutical Products Inc. (TAP) joint
venture, evenly splitting the value and assets of the joint venture.&#160; Abbott exchanged its 50 percent equity
interest in TAP for the assets, liabilities and employees related to TAP&#146;s <i>Lupron</i> business.&#160; Subsequent to the conclusion of the joint
venture, TAP was merged into two Takeda entities.&#160; The exchange of Abbott&#146;s investment in TAP
for TAP&#146;s <i>Lupron</i> business
resulted in a gain at closing of approximately $94 million.&#160; The Internal Revenue Service has issued a
private letter ruling that the transaction qualifies as tax-free for U.S.
income tax purposes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beginning on May&nbsp;1,
2008, Abbott began recording U.S. <i>Lupron</i>
net sales and costs in its operating results and no longer records income from
the TAP joint venture.&#160; TAP&#146;s sales of <i>Lupron</i> were $182 million for the four
months ended April&nbsp;30, 2008 and $645 million for the full year 2007.&#160; Abbott also receives payments based on
specified development, approval and commercial events being achieved with
respect to products retained by Takeda and payments from Takeda based on sales
of products retained by Takeda, which are recorded by Abbott as Other (income)
expense, net as earned.&#160; Such payments,
which are subject to tax, are expected to approximate $1.4 billion over the five-year
period beginning on May&nbsp;1, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The exchange transaction
was accounted for as a sale of Abbott&#146;s equity interest in TAP and as an
acquisition of TAP&#146;s <i>Lupron</i>
business under SFAS No.&nbsp;141 &#147;Business Combinations.&#148;&#160; The sale of Abbott&#146;s equity interest in TAP
resulted in the recording of net assets related to the <i>Lupron</i> business, primarily cash,
receivables, inventory and other assets, net of accounts payable and other
accrued liabilities, offset by a credit to Abbott&#146;s investment in TAP in the
amount of approximately $280 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the acquired <i>Lupron</i> business, Abbott recorded
intangible assets, primarily <i>Lupron</i>
product rights, of approximately $700 million, goodwill of approximately $350
million and deferred tax liabilities related primarily to the intangible assets
of approximately $260 million.&#160; The
intangible assets are being amortized over 15 years.&#160; Abbott has also agreed to remit cash to
Takeda if certain research and development events are not achieved on the
development assets retained by Takeda.&#160;
These amounts were recorded as a liability at closing in the amount of
approximately $1.1 billion.&#160; Related
deferred tax assets of approximately $410 million were also recorded, resulting
in an after-tax liability of approximately $700 million.&#160; Of the $1.1 billion, Abbott will make
tax-deductible payments of $200 million in the fourth quarter of 2008 and
approximately $120 million in 2009.&#160; If
the remaining payments are not required, the liability would be reduced and a
gain would be recorded.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 50 percent-owned
joint venture was accounted for under the equity method of accounting.&#160; Summarized financial information for TAP
follows below (<i>in millions</i>).&#160; The results for 2008 include results through April&nbsp;30.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="88%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:88.0%;">

  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.4%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.86%;">

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.2%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.22%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2007</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.24%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="40%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:19.24%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">741</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.56%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\105537\08-26469-1\task3197997\26469-1-fe.htm',USER='105537',CD='Oct 31 20:54 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in .2in .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL REVIEW</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 1.1pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 1.1pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Restructurings</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(dollars
in millions)</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
the third quarter of 2008, Abbott management approved a plan to streamline
global manufacturing operations, reduce overall costs, and improve efficiencies
in Abbott&#146;s core diagnostic business.&#160;
This plan will result in pre-tax charges of approximately $370 over the
next several years.&nbsp; These charges include employee-related costs of
approximately $110, accelerated depreciation of approximately $75, and other
related exit costs of approximately $185, mainly related to product transfers.
In the third quarter 2008, Abbott recorded charges to Cost of products sold of
approximately $129 under the plan.&#160;
Additional charges of approximately $7 were subsequently recorded in the
third quarter of 2008 relating to this restructuring, primarily for accelerated
depreciation.&#160; The remainder of the
charges will occur through 2011 as a result of product re-registration
timelines required under manufacturing regulations in a number of countries and
product transition timelines.&#160; The
following summarizes the activity for this restructuring:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="88%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:88.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.56%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.2%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2008</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.56%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.56%;">

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.92%;">

  restructuring charges</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.56%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.74%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">

  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payments and
  other adjustments</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.2%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(16</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0.375pt 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.56%;">

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.92%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accrued balance
  at September&nbsp;30</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.74%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">113</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
2008, 2007 and 2006, Abbott management approved plans to realign its worldwide
pharmaceutical manufacturing operations and selected domestic and international
commercial and research and development operations in order to reduce
costs.&#160; Additional charges of $61 and $77
were subsequently recorded in the first nine months of 2008 and 2007,
respectively, relating to these restructurings, primarily for accelerated
depreciation.&#160; In addition, Abbott
implemented facilities restructuring plans in the second quarter of 2007
related to the acquired operations of Kos Pharmaceuticals Inc., which resulted
in an increase to goodwill of approximately $52.&#160; The following summarizes the activity for
restructurings:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5in .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 62.3pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basis
of Presentation</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 62.3pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;vertical-align:baseline;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott&#146;s
core laboratory diagnostics business, including Point of Care, was accounted
for as discontinued operations for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
2007.&#160; Subsequently, a decision was made
to retain the businesses.&#160; The results
for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2007 included depreciation and
amortization through January&nbsp;17, 2007.&#160;
Depreciation and amortization that was discontinued in the amount
of approximately $99 million was recorded in the third quarter of 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;vertical-align:baseline;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
the third quarter of 2008, Abbott announced that it had reached an agreement to
sell Abbott&#146;s spine business for $360 million in cash.&#160; The transaction closed in October&nbsp;2008
and a pretax gain of approximately $150 million will be recorded in the fourth
quarter of 2008.&#160; The operations and
financial position of the spine business are not presented as discontinued
operations because the effects would not be significant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 62.3pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquired
In-process Research and Development</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 62.3pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the
first half of 2008, technology investments and acquired product rights resulted
in charges to acquired in-process research and development of approximately $97
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5in .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest (Income)</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5in .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest income
increased in the third quarter and first nine months of 2008 over 2007
primarily as the result of higher investment balances.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\JMS\105537\08-26469-1\task3197997\26469-1-fe.htm',USER='105537',CD='Oct 31 20:54 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL REVIEW</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">(continued)</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other (income) expense,
net</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As described above, Abbott recorded a gain of
approximately $94 million in connection with the dissolution of the TAP
Pharmaceutical Products Inc. joint venture in the second quarter of 2008, which
is included in Other (income) expense, net.&#160;
Other (income) expense, net for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2008 also includes a gain of approximately $52 million on the sale of an equity
investment accounted for as an available-for-sale investment.&#160; Other (income) expense, net for the third
quarter of 2008 and the remainder of Other (income) expense, net for the nine
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2008 relates primarily to contractual payments
based on specified development, approval and commercial events being achieved
with respect to products retained by Takeda and payments from Takeda based on
sales of products retained by Takeda.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other (income)
expense, net for the third quarter of 2007 includes a $35 million fair market
value loss adjustment to Abbott&#146;s investment in Boston Scientific common
stock.&#160; Other (income) expense, net for
the first nine months of 2007 includes a $136 million fair market value loss
adjustment to Abbott&#146;s investment in Boston Scientific common stock and a
realized gain of $37 million on the sales of Boston Scientific stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 22.5pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Taxes on Earnings</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 22.5pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Taxes on earnings
reflect the estimated annual effective rates.&#160;
The effective tax rates are less than the statutory U.S. federal income
tax rate principally due to the domestic dividend exclusion in 2007 and the benefit
of lower statutory tax rates and tax exemptions in several taxing
jurisdictions. In the second quarter of 2008, Abbott&#146;s federal income tax
returns for 2004 and 2005 were settled, resulting in a net reduction of income
taxes of approximately $30 million.&#160; On October&nbsp;3,
2008, President Bush signed into law H.R.1424, the Emergency Economic
Stabilization Act of 2008, which among other things extended the research and
development tax credit.&#160; As a result of
the extension of the research and development tax credit, the annual effective
tax rate will be slightly lower than the effective tax rate for the nine months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .2pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liquidity and
Capital Resources at September&nbsp;30, 2008 Compared with December&nbsp;31,
2007</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in .2pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash from
operating activities for the first nine months 2008 totaled approximately $5.8
billion. The increase in Other, net in Net cash from operating activities from
2007 to 2008 reflects primarily increased accruals for cost improvement
initiatives and payroll related obligations.&#160;
Abbott expects annual cash flow from operating activities to continue to
exceed Abbott&#146;s capital expenditures and cash dividends.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Working capital
was $5.7 billion at September&nbsp;30, 2008 and $4.9 billion at December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the acquired <i>Lupron</i> business, Abbott recorded
intangible assets, primarily <i>Lupron</i>
product rights, of approximately $700 million, goodwill of approximately $350
million and deferred tax liabilities related to the intangible assets of
approximately $260 million.&#160; Abbott also
recorded a liability of approximately $1.1 billion relating to an agreement to
remit cash to Takeda if certain research and development events are not
achieved on the development assets retained by Takeda.&#160; Related deferred tax assets of approximately
$410 million were also recorded, resulting in an after-tax liability of
approximately $700 million.&#160; Of the $1.1
billion, Abbott will make tax-deductible payments of $200 million in the fourth
quarter of 2008 and approximately $120 million in 2009.&#160; If the remaining payments are not required,
the liability would be reduced and a gain would be recorded.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At September&nbsp;30,
2008, Abbott&#146;s long-term debt rating was AA by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s
Corporation and A1 by Moody&#146;s Investors Service.&#160; Abbott has readily available financial resources,
including unused lines of credit of $4.0 billion that support commercial paper borrowing arrangements.&#160; Abbott&#146;s access to short-term financing has
not been affected by the current credit market conditions.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL REVIEW</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2006, the board
of directors authorized the purchase of $2.5 billion of Abbott&#146;s common shares
from time to time.&#160; During the first nine
months of 2008 and 2007, Abbott purchased approximately 19.0 million of its
common shares in each period at a cost of approximately $1.1 billion and $1.0
billion, respectively under this authorization.&#160;
Effective in the fourth quarter no more purchases of common shares will
be made from this authorization.&#160; In October&nbsp;2008,
the board of directors authorized the purchase of up to $5 billion of Abbott&#146;s
common shares from time to time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .9pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .2pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under a
registration statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission in February&nbsp;2006,
Abbott may offer and sell from time to time debt securities in one or more
offerings through February&nbsp;2009.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .2pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Legislative Issues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott&#146;s primary
markets are highly competitive and subject to substantial government regulation
throughout the world.&#160; Abbott expects
debate to continue over the availability, method of delivery, and payment for
health care products and services.&#160;
Abbott believes that if legislation is enacted, it could have the effect
of reducing access to health care products and services, or reducing prices or
the rate of price increases for health care products and services.&#160; It is not possible to predict the extent to
which Abbott or the health care industry in general might be adversely affected
by these factors in the future.&#160; A more
complete discussion of&nbsp;these factors is contained in Item 1A, Risk
Factors, Item 1, Business, and Item 1A, Risk Factors on Form&nbsp;10-K for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and in Item 1A, Risk Factors on Form&nbsp;10-Q
for the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Private Securities
Litigation Reform Act of 1995 &#151; A Caution Concerning Forward-Looking Statements</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 5.4pt .0001pt 0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under
the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of
1995, Abbott cautions investors that any forward-looking statements or
projections made by Abbott, including those made in this document, are subject
to risks and uncertainties that may cause actual results to differ materially
from those projected. Economic, competitive, governmental, technological and
other factors that may affect Abbott&#146;s operations are discussed in Item 1A,
Risk Factors, Item 1A, Risk Factors to the Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and in Item 1A, Risk Factors on Form&nbsp;10-Q
for the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;I.&#160; FINANCIAL INFORMATION</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item
4.</font></u><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Controls
and Procedures</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Evaluation of disclosure controls and procedures.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Chief Executive Officer, Miles D. White, and Chief Financial Officer, Thomas C.
Freyman, evaluated the effectiveness of Abbott Laboratories&#146; disclosure
controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this report, and
concluded that Abbott Laboratories&#146; disclosure controls and procedures were
effective to ensure that information Abbott is required to disclose in the reports
that it files or submits with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;) is recorded, processed,
summarized and reported, within the time periods specified in the Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and
forms, and to ensure that information required to be disclosed by Abbott in the
reports that it files or submits under the Exchange Act is accumulated and
communicated to Abbott&#146;s management, including its principal executive officer
and principal financial officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions
regarding required disclosure.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Changes in internal control over financial reporting.</font></i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; During the quarter ended September&nbsp;30,
2008, there were no changes in Abbott&#146;s internal control over financial reporting
(as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;under the Exchange Act) that have
materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, Abbott&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\JMS\105575\08-26469-1\task3198496\26469-1-fg.htm',USER='105575',CD='Nov  1 01:08 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;II.&#160; &#160;&#160;OTHER
INFORMATION</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 47.9pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-47.9pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1.</font></u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Legal
Proceedings</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 47.9pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-47.9pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott is involved in
various claims, legal proceedings and investigations, including, (as of September&nbsp;30,
2008, except where a different date is indicated) those described below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its 2007 Form&nbsp;10-K,
Abbott reported that several lawsuits are pending against Abbott, Fournier
Industrie et Sante, and Laboratoires Fournier, S.A., alleging antitrust and
unfair competition claims in connection with the sale of fenofibrate
formulations.&#160; During the third quarter
of 2008, the United States District Court for the District of Delaware
certified a class of direct purchasers and a class of indirect purchasers of
fenofibrate formulations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its Form&nbsp;10-Q for
the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2008, Abbott reported that the case <i>Patrick Warren Proffitt, et. al.</i> was filed
against Abbott in the Circuit Court for Cocke County, Tennessee alleging
antitrust and consumer fraud claims in connection with the sale of fenofibrate
formulations.&#160; During the third quarter
of 2008, the court granted Abbott&#146;s motion to transfer this case to the United
States District Court for the District of Delaware.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its Form&nbsp;10-Q for
the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2008, Abbott reported that a number of cases
are pending that allege generally that Abbott and numerous other pharmaceutical
companies reported false pricing information in connection with certain drugs
that are reimbursable under Medicare and Medicaid and by private payors and
that the federal cases have been consolidated in the United States District
Court for the District of Massachusetts as <i>In
re: Pharmaceutical Industry Average Wholesale Price Litigation, MDL 1456</i>.&#160; During the third quarter of 2008, Abbott
settled four cases brought by the State Attorneys General on behalf of,
respectively, Montana, Nevada, Pennsylvania, and Texas.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its 2007 Form&nbsp;10-K,
Abbott reported that several lawsuits are pending against Abbott in the United
States District Court for the Northern District of California that allege
generally antitrust violations in connection with the 2003 Norvir
re-pricing.&#160; During the third quarter of
2008, Abbott entered into a settlement of the consolidated class action filed
on behalf of individual consumers, <i>John Doe
1</i> (filed April&nbsp;2004), and the lawsuit brought by third-party payors,
<i>Service Employees International Health and
Welfare Fund </i>(filed October&nbsp;2004), contingent upon the Ninth
Circuit Court of Appeals accepting Abbott&#146;s appeal of a ruling by the
court.&#160; In <i>Louisiana Wholesale Drug Company,&nbsp;Inc.</i> (filed December&nbsp;2007),
<i>Meijer,&nbsp;Inc.</i> (filed November&nbsp;2007)
and <i>Rochester Drug Co-Operative,&nbsp;Inc. </i>(filed
November&nbsp;2007), the court certified a class of direct purchasers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its 2007 Form&nbsp;10-K,
Abbott reported that litigation was pending in Germany in which Evysio Medical
Devices ULC (Evysio) sued Abbott for infringement of one of its stent design
patents by the original designs of Abbott&#146;s Multi-Link Vision &#174; and Xience V&#153;
stents.&#160; In July&nbsp;2008, the German
Federal Patent Court revoked the Evysio patent in Germany.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\JMS\105575\08-26469-1\task3198496\26469-1-fg.htm',USER='105575',CD='Nov  1 01:08 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In its 2007 Form&nbsp;10-K,
Abbott reported that its subsidiary Advanced Cardiovascular Systems,&nbsp;Inc.
filed a motion seeking to enjoin Medtronic Vascular,&nbsp;Inc. (Medtronic),
from infringing activities related to Medtronic&#146;s stent designs and that
Medtronic filed a motion to stay proceedings related to the injunction.&#160; Abbott also reported that Medtronic&#146;s motion
to stay was denied with respect to the named bare metal stents, and was granted
with respect to the Endeavor stent.&#160; In September&nbsp;2008,
the court lifted the stay with respect to the Endeavor stent, but denied Abbott&#146;s
motion for an injunction.&#160; Medtronic has
filed a notice of appeal with respect to the underlying liability findings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">While it is not feasible to predict with certainty the outcome of the
pending claims, proceedings and investigations in which Abbott is involved, including
those previously disclosed, management is of the opinion that their ultimate
dispositions should not have a material adverse effect on Abbott&#146;s financial
position, cash flows, or results of operations, except for the case filed in April&nbsp;2007
referred to in the second paragraph of Note 6 to Abbott&#146;s financial statements
above and the cases described in the third paragraph of such note.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\JMS\105575\08-26469-1\task3198496\26469-1-fg.htm',USER='105575',CD='Nov  1 01:08 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1A.</font></u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Risk Factors</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There have been no material changes in our risk factors from those
disclosed in Abbott&#146;s 2007 Form&nbsp;10-K and Form&nbsp;10-Q for the quarter
ended June&nbsp;30, 2008, except for the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Other factors can have a material adverse effect on
Abbott&#146;s future profitability and financial condition.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Many other factors can affect Abbott&#146;s profitability and its financial
condition, including:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Differences between the fair value
measurement of assets and liabilities and their actual value, particularly for
pensions, retiree health care, stock compensation, intangibles and goodwill;
and for contingent liabilities such as litigation, the absence of a recorded
amount, or an amount recorded at the minimum, compared to the actual amount.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in or interpretations of laws and
regulations including changes in accounting standards, taxation requirements
and environmental laws in domestic or foreign jurisdictions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in the rate of inflation (including
the cost of raw materials, commodities and supplies), interest rates, market
value of Abbott&#146;s equity investments, and the performance of investments held
by Abbott or Abbott&#146;s employee benefit trusts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in the creditworthiness of
counterparties that transact business with or provide services to Abbott or
Abbott&#146;s employee benefit trusts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in business and political conditions,
including (i)&nbsp;war, political instability, terrorist attacks in the U.S.
and other parts of the world, the threat of future terrorist activity in the
U.S. and other parts of the world and related military action, (ii)&nbsp;natural
disasters, (iii)&nbsp;the cost and availability of insurance due to any of the
foregoing events, (iv)&nbsp;labor disputes, strikes, slow-downs or other forms
of labor or union activity, and (v)&nbsp;pressure from third-party interest
groups.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in Abbott&#146;s business units and
investments and changes in the relative and absolute contribution of each to
earnings and cash flow resulting from evolving business strategies, changing
product mix, changes in tax rates both in the U.S. and abroad and opportunities
existing now or in the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in the buying patterns of a major
distributor, retailer, or wholesale customer resulting from buyer purchasing
decisions, pricing, seasonality, or other factors, or other problems with
licensors, suppliers, distributors and business partners.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Difficulties related to Abbott&#146;s information
technology systems, any of which could adversely affect business operations,
including any significant breakdown, invasion, destruction or interruption of
these systems.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
